newsitem.title: USA: OshKosh B'Gosh to close Kentucky plant.
newsitem.headline: OshKosh B'Gosh to close Kentucky plant.

text.p: OshKosh B'Gosh Inc said Tuesday it will close its manufacturing plant in Columbia, Ky., which makes children's woven bib overalls, jumpers and jeans, in mid-March.

"Excess capacity, mainly a result of a shift in consumers' demand to more knit products versus woven products, has led to a decrease in available work for our Columbia operation," Michael Wachtel, chief operating officer, said in a statement issued here. "Regrettably, we have no alternative but to close this facility."
Any future demand for the type of products currently manufactured at Columbia will be primarily sourced offshore, the company said.

"Over five years ago we began implementing a strategy to develop our offshore sourcing capabilities," Wachtel said. "We have been forced to develop this capability as a means of survival in an increasingly competitive marketplace."
The Columbia plant employs about 413 people. Eligible employees will receive severance pay and outplacement assistance.
OshKosh B'Gosh said it is actively pursuing a buyer for the Columbia facility.

Excluding the Columbia facility, OshKosh B'Gosh operates seven manufacturing and two distribution centers, employing over 3,000 people in the United States. Total corporate-wide employment is approximately 5,500 employees.
OshKosh B'Gosh, which makes children's apparel, is based in Oshkosh, Wis.
